snippet: Attacks in Kabul and three eastern provinces were largely contained Monday with 38 of the attackers killed, Afghan officials said.
abstract: Complex Taliban attacks on Kabul, Afghanistan, and in main cities of three eastern provinces end with 39 of the attackers killed; just five civilians are killed in the attacks.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sangar Rahimi and Graham Bowley from Kabul; an employee of The New York Times from Khost Province, Afghanistan; and J. David Goodman from New York.

lead_paragraph: Attacks in Kabul and three eastern provinces were largely contained Monday with 38 of the attackers killed, Afghan officials said.

headline.seo: Afghan Forces End Taliban Attack That Shook Kabul
headline.main: Afghan Forces Quell Attack; Few Civilians Are Killed
headline.print_headline: Afghan Forces Quell Attack; Few Civilians Are Killed

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
